tool.name: CAD2LGIM

param.name: input_cad
param.expression: CAD File {Buildling ID} {Floor Number} {Floor ID} {Floor Count} {Floor Description} {Base Elevation} {Ceiling Height} {Vertical Order};CAD File {Buildling ID} {Floor Number} {Floor ID} {Floor Count} {Floor Description} {Base Elevation} {Ceiling Height} {Vertical Order}...
param.dialogReference: This is the input dataset(s). Simply input the location of the AIA-Compliant CAD data file(s) here. For added convenience, you can populate this and other inputs in the config.xlsm file at the same folder level as the toolbox. Filling out the excel spreadsheet will be the best option for most people.

param.name: lgim_data_model
param.dialogReference: The path to the GDB that is set up with the ArcGIS Local Government Information Model. For more information about this data model and how it supports the creation of indoor GIS Datasets, please see here: http://solutions.arcgis.com/local-government/help/local-government-information-model/

param.name: ref_scale
param.dialogReference: The reference scale defines the scale at which symbols appear at their intended size. When a reference scale is set, changes in scale result in symbols changing size relative to surrounding features. If no reference scale is set, symbols remain a constant size and do not change size relative to surrounding features. The default value is set at 1000.

param.name: spatial_ref
param.dialogReference: Output spatial reference for the ArcGIS dataset. Be sure to specify an appropriate Z Projection system as well. This will be available in a separate tab in the interactive dialog.

param.name: output_qc_gdb
param.dialogReference: Path to the associated QC geodatabase. This database is intended to catch input features that fall outside the parameters designated when running the tool. For example, if a minimum area or merge_floor feature class is specified, and input CAD features fall outside these filter parameters, the omitted features will be written to the QC database.

param.name: bldgintspace_import_polys
param.dialogReference: Some CAD files contain polygons for indoor spaces. If the input CAD data for this tool has these polygons defined, checking this option box will import them directly.

param.name: min_area
param.dialogReference: Optional filter for setting the minimum indoor area size to be imported to the GDB. Features that are smaller than this size will be written to the QC GDB.

param.name: merge_floor
param.dialogReference: If checked, the tool will dissolve the BuildingFloor polygons on the BUILDINGKEY field and appends the dissolved feature(s) to the Building feature class. If unchecked, features from the CAD file are exported based on the layers listed under the Building field in the tool config file. This might result in an irregular footprint or intersecting features in the Building feature class if the floors of a building are not coincident in the input CAD data.

tool.summary: This tool is designed to simplify the workflow of importing AIA-compliant CAD data into the ArcGIS Local Government Information Model. This is a key part of the workflow required to generate indoor space datasets from existing CAD data. This tool is intended to be a companion to the ArcGIS Campus Editing Template and other components of the 3D Campus Indoor Network workflow.
tool.usage: In order to use this tool successfully. It is necessary to start with CAD data that conforms to the AIA standard.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool is designed to simplify the workflow of importing AIA-compliant CAD data into the ArcGIS Local Government Information Model. This is a key part of the workflow required to generate indoor space datasets from existing CAD data. This tool is intended to be a companion to the ArcGIS Campus Editing Template and other components of the 3D Campus Indoor Network workflow.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Esri Professional Services. Esri Product Engineering Content Team.

Consts.useLimit: This is an unsupported sample provided as a courtesy by Esri for the benefit of our community. Please direct any questions or issues to the comments section for these tools and they will be addressed as soon as possible.
